snippet: A judge refused Thursday to dismiss misdemeanor charges against a Kansas City diocese and its bishop, who is the highest-ranking Roman Catholic official in the United States criminally charged with shielding an abusive priest.
abstract: Missouri court refuses to dismiss misdemeanor charges against a Catholic Diocese of Kansas City and Bishop Robert Finn, the highest-ranking Roman Catholic official in the United States, for allegedly shielding an abusive priest.
lead_paragraph: A judge refused Thursday to dismiss misdemeanor charges against a Kansas City diocese and its bishop, who is the highest-ranking Roman Catholic official in the United States criminally charged with shielding an abusive priest.

headline.main: Missouri: Judge Lets Charges Stand Against Bishop
headline.print_headline: Missouri: Judge Lets Charges Stand Against Bishop
